what: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: package create labels, certificates, much ! :) need create attendance participation certificates, accreditation badges, herbarium collection labels, labeleR package need! Keep eye easy tutorial use !

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: install labeleR GitHub, might need install devtools package. , just specify repository install! want clone repository, can find code .
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("EcologyR/labeleR") library(labeleR)

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: first place, must warn renderization documents labeleR depends LaTeX, must installed first place. Don’t worry, easy!
code: # install.packages("tinytex") tinytex::install_tinytex()

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: first thing need start using labeleR data frame information included. data frame can imported R environment reading file (e.g. ‘.csv’ file ‘.xlsx2’ excel sheet, using read.table( ) alike functions), can also imported Google Sheets function. , just use labeleR’s read_sheet( ) function, specifying Google Sheet URL. fact, don’t need use whole URL, just specific part . instance, URL: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1inkk3_oNvvt8ajdK4wOkSgPoUyE8JzENrZgSTFJEFBw/edit#gid=0 just need text bold. However, key point bear mind Google Sheet document must grant (least viewer) access anyone link; otherwise R able open . case just want import rows (let’s say create , re-create correcting mistake), don´t import rows. Using select.column parameter, can import rows match select.value . example, just want create certificate Draco Malfoy attendee class, can use following code import just row:
code: people_list_long <- read_sheet("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1inkk3_oNvvt8ajdK4wOkSgPoUyE8JzENrZgSTFJEFBw/edit#gid=0")  people_list <- read_sheet("1inkk3_oNvvt8ajdK4wOkSgPoUyE8JzENrZgSTFJEFBw")                            # The result is the same, a R data frame that can be used by labeleR read_sheet(url="1inkk3_oNvvt8ajdK4wOkSgPoUyE8JzENrZgSTFJEFBw",             select.column = "List_assistants", select.value = "Draco Malfoy")

what: 1.2 Some advice for the labeleR functions
title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: using labeleR’s functions, widely used parameters nomenclature must acknowledged. parameters, 2 always . first one data, data frame previously loaded . second one path, folder outputted PDFs stored. case specified folder exist, automatically created. labels, pictures (logos signatures) can included. , parameter names lpic (standing left picture, top), rpic (right picture, also top) signature.pic (signature picture) certificates; logo collection label. pictures specified path picture stored. parameters nomenclature, two kinds. “Fixed parameters” remain certificates (e.g. name conference accreditation, name speaker attendance certificate). parameters named using unique word (e.g. event speaker), can filled using free text printed documents. hand, “variable parameters” vary among documents, therefore differ among rows (e.g. attendees names conference, species herbarium labels). specify column data information stored, two-word parameters used (.e. name.column species.column). parameter follow philosophy qr functions allow plot (.e. create_herbarium_label, create_collection_label create_tinylabel). parameter can set column name, result variable parameter, free text (column name), used fixed one.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: Now let’s start using labeleR! help see structure templates visual way, display examples inspired Harry Potter universe.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: Attendance certificates one least variable certificates; variable parameter name attendees. template allows include signature image, signer go . certificate available english spanish. case pictures look big small, recommend modify size, set given height. structure certificate looks follows.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: example, create four different certificates four students Hogwarts School, Headmaster certifies attended 200 h Potions class.
code: data <- read_sheet("1inkk3_oNvvt8ajdK4wOkSgPoUyE8JzENrZgSTFJEFBw")  create_certificate_attendance( data=data,   path = "LabeleR_output",   language="en",   type="class",   title="Potions Class",   organiser="Hogwarts School year 1992-1993",   signer="A.P.W.B. Dumbledore",   signer.position="School Headmaster",   hours=200,   date="01/01/2021",   speaker="Severus Snape",   rpic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/Hogwarts_logo.png", package = "labeleR"),   lpic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/Hogwarts_logo.png", package = "labeleR"),   signature.pic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/dumbledore.png", package = "labeleR"),   name.column="List_assistants" )

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: Participation certificates similar previous, variable parameters (speaker, title type communication, etc.). well attendance certificate, documents can renderized english spanish.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: , Albus Dumbledore certifies four school teachers participated seminars different titles, different affiliations, dates communication types.
code: data= read_sheet("11No4aLvta2qxGhkxD7W6HfNfGmO1wpCIDvyRKFF-_gM")  create_certificate_participation(   data = data,   path = "LabeleR_output",   language ="en",   type="online seminar",   organiser="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry",   hours= 2,   signer="A.P.W.B. Dumbledore",   signer.position="School Headmaster",   rpic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/Hogwarts_logo.png", package = "labeleR"),   lpic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/MinMagic.png", package = "labeleR"),   signature.pic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/dumbledore.png", package = "labeleR"),   name.column="Name",   affiliation.column="House",   date.column="Date",   title.column="Title",   comm.type.column = "Comm.type")

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: Accreditations rendered single document, eight accreditation cards per DIN-A4 page. two variable fields (name affiliation), can include two top images, although signed. Accreditation cards include dot line bottom individual hand-edition.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: example, present accreditation cards might used International Conference Muggleology, changing fields names affiliations attendees.
code: data <- read_sheet(url='16smXdP-Ehwu1cEmJTbJI1DerIpUrOcD7H5Ni6z9B07M') create_accreditation( data=data, path = "LabeleR_output", event="INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE OF MUGGLEOLOGY", name.column = "List", affiliation.column="Affiliation", rpic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/Hogwarts_logo.png", package = "labeleR"), lpic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/minMagic.png", package = "labeleR") )

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: Herbarium labels one documents variable parameters, lot information included. , used template believe useful, included three free fields user include information prefer. course, field’s name force user use category (location can set elevation column, top; vice versa), family.column content always capitalized, taxon.column one italics, recommend use stated. said , QR can stand free text (therefore remain identical labels), column name, therefore codes rendered specify individual information row. Including long texts may cause alteration structure labels, recommend concise.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: example, show labels students created herbarium assignment Herbology class.
code: data <- read_sheet(url='1Q005BDM0XyUNq5XzGWuvdzgZVMc4KhbYadVzi77h3Xw')  create_herbarium_label( data=data, path = "LabeleR_output",  title="Magical flora of the British Isles",  subtitle="Project: Eliminating plant blindness in Hogwarts students",  qr = "QR_code",  family.column="Family",  taxon.column="Taxon",  author.column="Author",  det.column="det/conf",  date.det.column="Det_date",  location.column="Location",  area.description.column="Area_description",  latitude.column="Latitude",  longitude.column="Longitude",  elevation.column="Elevation",  field1.column="life_form",  field2.column="Observations",  field3.column="Height",  collector.column="Collector",  collection.column="Collection_number",  assistants.column="Assistants",  date.column="Date"  )

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: Collection labels one aesthetic labels. five variable parameters (recommended long, explained herbarium labels), along possibility including QR code (fixed variable), logo image. Field 1 capitalized (family.column herbarium label, Field 2 italicized). fields can left blank. novelty, user may manually fix backgroud text colours preference, using HTML colour codes (code HEX, without ‘#’). default, background colours two hues green.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: example can see six labels created school’s displayed collection stuffed animals.
code: data <- read_sheet(url='1Bd_IVgGup4MapTgPq-cqqP05zYl-Q4SfUCBJ5oDSrMs',                    select.column = "field5",select.value = "Item 1") #We only include 1 Item of each species using the selection option in read_sheet()  create_collection_label( data = data, path = "LabeleR_output", qr = "QR_code", field1.column = "field1", field2.column = "field2", field3.column = "field3", field4.column = "field6", field5.column = "field7", logo = system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/Hogwarts_BnW.png", package = "labeleR"),  bgcolor = "D0ECC1",  #White is "FFFFFF" textcolor = "1E3F20" #Black is "000000" )

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: type labels simplified version previous, includes just five variable fields possibility including QR code. recommend previous cases include long texts neither variable parameters QR, can become difficult read. Tinylabels printed arrays 8x2 labels per page. case size big pretended use (can happen small insect collections, example), recommend use “print several pages per sheet” printer’s options.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: , tinylabels created typical collections stored boxes, normal collection label big.
code: data <- read_sheet(url='1Bd_IVgGup4MapTgPq-cqqP05zYl-Q4SfUCBJ5oDSrMs')  create_tinylabel( data = data, path = "LabeleR_output", qr = "QR_code", field1.column = "field1", field2.column = "field2", field3.column = "field3", field4.column = "field4", field5.column = "field5" )

title: Create certificate of attendance — create_certificate_attendance
text: data data frame  create attendance certificates. path Folder path output printed language Select english spanish type Type event (conference, workshop, seminar...) title Title event organiser Name organizing entity hours Number hours event lasted signer Person credits certificate signer.position Position signer date Date event speaker Name speaker event lpic PNG object. File route top-left image. Can blank set NULL. rpic PNG object. File route top-right image. Can blank set NULL. signature.pic PNG object. File route signature image. Can blank set NULL. name.column Column name Google Sheet column specifies attendee's name.

title: Function to create create collection labels (8 per DIN-A4 page) — create_collection_label
code: create_collection_label(   data = data,   path = NULL,   qr = NULL,   field1.column = NULL,   field2.column = NULL,   field3.column = NULL,   field4.column = NULL,   field5.column = NULL,   logo = NULL,   bgcolor = NULL,   textcolor = NULL )

title: Function to create create collection labels (8 per DIN-A4 page) — create_collection_label
text: data Data frame including create labels. path Folder path output printed qr String. Free text column data specifies text create QR code. specified value column name data, QRs equal, output specified qr. field1.column Column data specifies text print first field. field2.column Column data specifies text print second field. field3.column Column data specifies text print third field. field4.column Column data specifies text print fourth field. field5.column Column data specifies text print fifth field. logo PNG object route. File route bottom image. Can blank set NULL. bgcolor HTML color use label background. Default D0ECC1 textcolor HTML color use label text. Default 1E3F20

title: Function to create create collection labels (8 per DIN-A4 page) — create_collection_label
text: Julia G. de Aledo, Ignacio Ramos-Gutierrez

title: Function to create create collection labels (8 per DIN-A4 page) — create_collection_label
code: data <- read_sheet("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/         1Bd_IVgGup4MapTgPq-cqqP05zYl-Q4SfUCBJ5oDSrMs/edit?usp=sharing")  if (FALSE) { create_collection_label( data = data, path = "LabeleR_output", qr = "QR_code", field1.column = "field1", field2.column = "field2", field3.column = "field3", field4.column = "field6", field5.column = "field7" ) }

what: Function to create herbaruim labels (4 per DIN-A4 page) — create_herbarium_label
title: Function to create herbaruim labels (4 per DIN-A4 page) — create_herbarium_label
text: Function create herbaruim labels (4 per DIN-A4 page)

title: Function to create herbaruim labels (4 per DIN-A4 page) — create_herbarium_label
code: create_herbarium_label(   data = data,   path = NULL,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   qr = NULL,   family.column = NULL,   taxon.column = NULL,   author.column = NULL,   det.column = NULL,   date.det.column = NULL,   location.column = NULL,   area.description.column = NULL,   latitude.column = NULL,   longitude.column = NULL,   elevation.column = NULL,   field1.column = NULL,   field2.column = NULL,   field3.column = NULL,   collector.column = NULL,   collection.column = NULL,   assistants.column = NULL,   date.column = NULL )

title: Function to create herbaruim labels (4 per DIN-A4 page) — create_herbarium_label
text: data data frame create herbarium labels. path Folder path output printed title Main title top labels. Can blank set NULL. subtitle Subtitle bottom labels. Can blank set NULL. qr String. Free text column data specifies text create QR code. specified value column name data, QRs equal, output specified qr. family.column Column name data data frame specifies labels' family name. taxon.column Column name data data frame specifies labels' taxon. author.column Column name data data frame specifies taxons' author. det.column Column name data data frame specifies determiner voucher. date.det.column Column name data data frame specifies date voucher determined. location.column Column name data data frame specifies voucher collected. area.description.column Column name data data frame specifies decription area latitude.column Column name data data frame specifies latitude specimen collected. longitude.column Column name data data frame specifies longitude specimen collected. elevation.column Column name data data frame specifies elevation specimen collected. field1.column Column name data data frame specifying variable user's choice. Can blank set NULL. field2.column Column name data data frame specifying variable user's choice. Can blank set NULL. field3.column Column name data data frame specifying variable user's choice. Can blank set NULL. collector.column Column name data data frame specifies name collector voucher. collection.column Column name data data frame specifies voucher's collection number. assistants.column Column name data data frame specifies names collector's assistants. date.column Column name data data frame specifies date specimen collected.

title: Function to create herbaruim labels (4 per DIN-A4 page) — create_herbarium_label
